channel.title: [tut] html :)
channel.description:
[size=15pt]More To Come! ;D[/size] Welcome to my small tutorial on Basic HTML. I had completely nothing else to do, so I decided to just do this. :) [b]Here Are The Main Text Formats:[/b] [code] BOLD STRONG BIG EMPHASIZED ITALIC SMALL [/code] Ok, You MUST HAVE THE BRACKETS(<>)! I think that by Looking at the HTML Txt Formats, its pretty easy to understand what they mean.. For line breaks, type "
". P.S. Emphasized & Bold, are almost exactly alike. [b]Creating Links:[/b] [code] Moparisthebest.com [/code] This is a link to Moparisthebest.com, the "http://" Has got to be there, the "www." Does not. HINT:: Having a link like this one, will open the webpage in the same browser! [code] Moparisthebest.com [/code] This link will open the webpage in a different browser becuase you set the target to _blank. [code] [/code] This link will use the moparisthebest.com's banner as a link... I think its pretty simple to do this, it's just like all other links except you use the Image URL. [code] Email Me [/code] A Mailto Link. As you can probally see this is pretty simple. But only ONE THING, you MUST replace spaces with "%20" so that your browser wont misread it. Ok, thats enough links for now :D. [b]Font Colors:[/b] Well, to change the font color its actuall really easy. All you have to do is pick a font color you want and put it in a code like this, [code] Moparisthebest.com Tutorial on HTML [/code] This will change the Font Color to "aqua" but you can change it to any color you would like. :) [b]Drop Down Lists & Checkboxes:[/b] Drop Down List [code]
[/code] The "select name=""" can be changed to anything you like, really it doesn't matter. Also, the "option value=""" can be changed to anything. Just as long as the text before "" is what you want it to say. Checkbox [code] Moparisthebest is the best:
This tutorial is on HTML:
I now like HTML: [/code] This will make a small checkbox for each option :) [b]Input Fields:[/b] [code]
Username:
Password:
[/code] This will just let someone type in their username and password.. to make it Mailto Someone use this code, it enters a mailto button :) [code]
Username:

Password:


[/code] Where you type your password in at, the input type is password, so that way it hides it. [b]Website inside of an HTML Page:[/b] -Some browsers dont support this Using Iframes [code] [/code] All you have to do is replace the "http://www.moparisthebest.com" with what website you want to be in it. If your browser does not support Iframe then it will not show up. [b]Form That Sends You An E-Mail:[/b] [code] This form will send an email to you.
 Name:

Nickname:

EMail:

Comment:


[/code] You can change anything you want in here. But don't forget to change the "MAILTO:cabby@rsaddict.com" to your email. Lol, I don't want to get a bunch of random Emails. :P

item.title: [tut] html :)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I would suggest that you not use the font element. And I highly suggest that you teach and along with forms, because those are invaluable elements to forms.

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] html :)
item.dc:creator: @alexia alexia
item.description:
@alexia wrote:

Not too bad. Although it didn’t really teach me stuff, it could still get someone started if they really want to learn it.

Also, use <b> Text </b> in this tutorial instead of <strong> Text </strong>

-Alexia

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] html :)
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

[size=15pt]More To Come! ;D[/size]

Welcome to my small tutorial on Basic HTML. I had completely nothing else to do, so I decided to just do this.

Here Are The Main Text Formats:

<b>BOLD</b>

<strong>
STRONG
</strong>

<big>
BIG
</big>

<em>
EMPHASIZED
</em>

<i>
ITALIC
</i>

<small>
SMALL
</small>

Ok, You MUST HAVE THE BRACKETS(<>)!
I think that by Looking at the HTML Txt Formats, its pretty easy to understand what they mean…
For line breaks, type “
”.
P.S. Emphasized & Bold, are almost exactly alike.

Creating Links:

<a href="http://www.moparisthebest.com"> Moparisthebest.com </a>

This is a link to Moparisthebest.com, the “http://” Has got to be there, the “www.” Does not.
HINT:: Having a link like this one, will open the webpage in the same browser!

<a href="http://www.moparisthebest.com" target="_blank"> Moparisthebest.com </a>

This link will open the webpage in a different browser becuase you set the target to _blank.

<a href="http://www.moparisthebest.com">
<img src="http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/mopar.gif">
</a>

This link will use the moparisthebest.com’s banner as a link…
I think its pretty simple to do this, it’s just like all other links except you use the Image URL.

<a href="mailto:cabby@rsaddict.com?subject=Hi%20I'm%20Caleb">
Email Me</a>

A Mailto Link. As you can probally see this is pretty simple.
But only ONE THING, you MUST replace spaces with “%20” so that your browser wont misread it.
Ok, thats enough links for now :D.

Font Colors:
Well, to change the font color its actuall really easy.
All you have to do is pick a font color you want and put it in a code like this,

<font color="aqua">Moparisthebest.com Tutorial on HTML </font>

This will change the Font Color to “aqua” but you can change it to any color you would like.

Drop Down Lists & Checkboxes:
Drop Down List

<form>
<select name="tutorial">
<option value="drop">DROP</option>
<option value="down">DOWN</option>
<option value="list">LIST</option>
<option value="part">PART</option>
</select>
</form>

The “select name=”"" can be changed to anything you like, really it doesn’t matter.
Also, the “option value=”"" can be changed to anything. Just as long as the text before “” is what you want it to say.

Checkbox

Moparisthebest is the best:
<input type="checkbox" name="nothing" value="Blah" />
<br />
This tutorial is on HTML: 
<input type="checkbox" name="nothing" value="blah" />
<br />
I now like HTML: 
<input type="checkbox" name="nothin" value="blah" />

This will make a small checkbox for each option

Input Fields:

<form>
Username: 
<input type="text" name="username">
<br>
Password: 
<input type="password" name="password">
</form>

This will just let someone type in their username and password…
to make it Mailto Someone use this code, it enters a mailto button 

<form action="MAILTO:cabby@rsaddict.com" method="post" enctype="text/plain">

Username:<br>
<input type="text" name="username"
value="" size="20">
<br>
Password:<br>
<input type="password" name="password"
value="" size="20">
<br><br>
<input type="submit" value="   Submit   ">

Where you type your password in at, the input type is password, so that way it hides it.

Website inside of an HTML Page: -Some browsers dont support this
Using Iframes

<html>
<body>

<iframe src="http://www.moparisthebest.com"></iframe>


</body>
</html>

All you have to do is replace the “http://www.moparisthebest.com” with what website you want to be in it.
If your browser does not support Iframe then it will not show up.

Form That Sends You An E-Mail:

<html>
<body>
<form action="MAILTO:cabby@rsaddict.com" method="post" enctype="text/plain">

<b>This form will send an email to you.<br></b>
Name:<br>
<input type="text" name="name"
value="Your Name" size="20">
<br>
Nickname:<br>
<input type="text" name="nname"
value="Your Nickname" size ="20">
<br>
EMail:<br>
<input type="text" name="mail"
value="Your Email" size="20">
<br>
Comment:<br>
<input type="text" name="comment"
value="Your Comment" size="40">
<br><br>
<input type="submit" value="Send">
<input type="reset" value="Reset">

</form>
</body>
</html>

You can change anything you want in here. But don’t forget to change the "MAILTO:cabby@rsaddict.com" to your email. Lol, I don’t want to get a bunch of random Emails.

Read full topic
